author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content:
Forward motion being wind assisted (the other force being current) must be quite inhibiting as to where it can actually safely go. Uncharted areas for increasing navigation would predominantly be coastal or sometimes ice covered like North Alaska. So it probably won’t be used there. However there are vast areas of open ocean where no measurements have been made because it has not been necessary, far away from trade routes etc.
So it will be collecting data, much of it of no relevance but maybe it will find new fish stocks for the Chinese to plunder.

author: Willy
content: Revelations? Woe is man when he can measure the foundations of the Earth.
